IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: COMMUNITY HOSPITAL COMMITTED TO WELLNESS PROMOTION, HOLISTIC HEALING & HEALTHCARE SERVICES
IRS990.MissionDescription: "ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE-COMMITTED TO WELLNESS PROMOTION AND HOLISTIC HEALING-PROVIDES HEALTHCARE SERVICES WHICH EMBODY COMPASSION, COMPETENCE AND COMMUNITY." ... NOT JUST WORDS, BUT A WAY OF LIFE - A NOBLE STATEMENT OF WHAT WE ARE, METICULOUSLY CRAFTED AFTER THOUGHTFUL CONSIDERATION, STUDY AND EXAMINATION OF ALL THE THINGS WE DO, BIG AND SMALL, DAY AND NIGHT, CARING FOR OUR PATIENTS. THESE ARE THE WORDS WE LIVE BY, EACH AND EVERY ONE OF US WHO COMPRISE THE CARING COMMUNITY OF ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE. WE TAKE OUR MISSION SERIOUSLY. THOSE WE SERVE DEPEND ON IT.ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDES QUALITY MEDICAL HEALTHCARE REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, SEX, NATIONAL ORIGIN, HANDICAP, AGE OR ABILITY TO PAY. ALTHOUGH REIMBURSEMENT FOR SERVICES RENDERED IS CRITICAL TO OPERATION AND STABILITY, IT IS RECOGNIZED THAT NOT ALL INDIVIDUALS POSSESS THE ABILITY TO PURCHASE ESSENTIAL MEDICAL SERVICES AND FURTHER THAT OUR MISSION IS TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY WITH RESPECT TO PROVIDING HEALTHCARE SERVICES.
IRS990.Description: ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDES QUALITY MEDICAL HEALTHCARE REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, SEX, NATIONAL ORIGIN, HANDICAP, AGE OR ABILITY TO PAY. ALTHOUGH REIMBURSEMENT FOR SERVICES RENDERED IS CRITICAL TO THE OPERATION AND STABILITY OF ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL, IT IS RECOGNIZED THAT NOT ALL INDIVIDUALS POSSESS THE ABILITY TO PURCHASE ESSENTIAL MEDICAL SERVICES AND FURTHER THAT OUR MISSION IS TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY WITH RESPECT TO PROVIDING HEALTHCARE SERVICES AND HEALTHCARE EDUCATION.ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL SERVED 3,929 INPATIENTS REPRESENTING 16,568 PATIENT DAYS AND SERVED MORE THAN 80,721 OUTPATIENTS REPRESENTING MORE THAN 3,406,476 TESTS AND PROCEDURES PERFORMED. ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDES CARE TO PERSONS COVERED BY GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAMS AT BELOW COST. RECOGNIZING ITS MISSION TO THE COMMUNITY, SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO BOTH MEDICARE AND MEDICAID PATIENTS. THE UNREIMBURSED VALUE OF PROVIDING CARE TO THESE PATIENTS IS $71,314,132. IN ADDITION, ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDED CHARITY CARE TOTALING $1,757,748 AND PROVIDED $6,275,693 IN SERVICES TO THOSE UNABLE TO PAY. CHARITY CARE IS ALSO PROVIDED THROUGH MANY REDUCED PRICE SERVICES AND FEE PROGRAMS OFFERED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR BASED UPON ACTIVITIES AND SERVICES WHICH ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL BELIEVES WILL SERVE A BONA FIDE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEED.FOR MORE INFORMATION REGARDING THE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS PROVIDED AT ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL AND THE HOSPITAL'S COMMITMENT TO SERVE ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.STJOESHEALING.ORG OR CONTACT THE PUBLIC AFFAIRS OFFICE AT (207)262-1720. 1) SURGICAL DEPARTMENT - OUR SURGERY CENTER WAS THE FIRST HOSPITAL-BASED DAY SURGERY FACILITY IN MAINE. IT FEATURES A CARING STAFF, INCLUDING ITS OWN DEDICATED ANESTHESIA TEAM, IN THE MODERN SURROUNDINGS OF OUR SURGICAL CENTER, WHICH HAS SIX SPACIOUS SUITES.

Activity2.Description: 2) ENDOSCOPY DEPARTMENT - OUR PHYSICIANS ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDE THE HIGHEST QUALITY DIGESTIVE DISEASE HEALTH CARE IN NORTHERN AND EASTERN MAINE INCLUDING THE PERFORMANCE OF LIFE-SAVING ENDOSCOPIC SCREENINGS AND PROCEDURES.

Activity3.Description: 3) EMERGENCY ROOM - 16-BED EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IS OPEN 24 HOURS A DAY, SEVEN DAYS A WEEK. IT INCLUDES SEVEN CARDIAC CARE ROOMS, INCLUDING THREE CRITICAL CARE ROOMS, AND ROOMS FOR TREATMENT OF EMERGENCY CASES IN: OBSTETRICS/GYNECOLOGY, ORTHOPEDICS AND OPHTHALMOLOGY (CONDITIONS AND INJURIES OF THE EYES). THERE ARE ALSO SEVERAL SUTURE ROOMS AND A DIGITAL X-RAY UNIT. THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IS STAFFED AROUND THE CLOCK BY PHYSICIANS, PHYSICIAN ASSISTANTS, REGISTERED NURSES, CNAS AND A SECRETARY. EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT GREETERS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FROM 7 A.M. TO 11:30 P.M. GREETERS HELP PATIENTS WITH REGISTRATION AND PROVIDE COMFORT TO THEM DURING THEIR VISIT.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: AMERICAN HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION DUES PAID WAS $24,588, OF WHICH 24.42% WAS ALLOCATED FOR LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. MAINE HEALTH ASSOCIATION DUES PAID WAS $52,286, OF WHICH 16.26% WAS ALLOCATED FOR LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENSURE THE LONG-TERM FINANCIAL VIABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION.
TRANSFERS TO AFFILIATES: $(5,803,948) ADJUSTMENT TO LONG-TERM PENSION OBLIGATIONS: $10,703 NET AUXILIARY INCOME:$(40,484)
AUXILIARY REVENUE: $113,564 FUNDRAISING EVENT DIRECT EXPENSES: $(73,080) REALIZED LOSSES: $(69,164)

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.Explanation: PART I, LINE 6A: COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEM, TEWKSBURY, MA

PART I, LINE 7: COSTS ARE FROM COST ACCOUNTING SYSTEM USING COST-TO-CHARGE RATIOS FROM THE AS FILED MEDICARE COST REPORT. THESE COSTS INCLUDE ALL PATIENTS, INPATIENT, OUTPATIENT AND EMERGENCY ROOM, AND ALL INSURANCE TYPES.

PART II: COMMUNITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES CONSISTED OF PHYSICAL IMPROVEMENTS, COMMUNITY SUPPORT, AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPROVEMENTS. PHYSICAL IMPOVEMENTS WERE A RESULT OF EMPLOYEES ASSISTING THE LOCAL ELDERLY POPULATION IN A VARIETY OF PROJECTS THOUGH THE EASTERN AREA AGENCY ON AGING. COMMUNITY SUPPORT CONSISTED OF AMERICAN RED CROSS BLOOD DRIVES, SENDING SUPPLIES TO TROOPS OVERSEAS, MAINTAINING A COMMUNITY VEGETABLE STAND, AND PROVIDING PASTORAL CARE IN THE COMMUNITY.

PART III, LINE 4: COSTS ARE FROM COST ACCOUNTING SYSTEM USING COST-TO-CHARGE RATIOS FROM THE AS FILED MEDICARE COST REPORT. ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL DOES NOT FACTOR IN DISCOUNTS AND PAYMENTS IN DETERMINING BAD DEBT EXPENSE.
PART III, LINE 8: COSTS ARE CALCULATED USING THE COST-TO-CHARGE RATIO FROM THE AS FILED MEDICARE COST REPORT.

PART VI, LINE 2: FOR THE PAST FEW YEARS, ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL HAS BEEN A PARTICIPANT IN THE HEALTH CARE COLLABORATIVE WHICH IS COMPRISED OF PENOBSCOT COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, EASTERN MAINE HEALTH SYSTEM AND ST JOSEPH HEALTHCARE. THROUGH STATE HEALTH AND LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH DATA AS WELL AS OTHER INITIATIVES, THE COLLABORATIVE AND THE INDIVIDUAL INSTITUTION ASSESS THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND PHYSICIAN COMMUNITY AS TO HOW TO ADDRESS THOSE NEEDS. THESE INITIATIVES ARE THEN INCORPORATED INTO THE INSTITUTION'S STRATEGIC PLAN. THIS PAST YEAR ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE HAS BECOME A PARTICIPANT IN A BEACON GRANT WITH ELEVEN OTHER INSTITUTIONS WITH THE FOCUS ON ADDRESSING CHRONIC DISEASES AND THE MANAGEMENT OF CARE.

PART VI, LINE 3: THE ORGANIZATION POSTS WRITTEN NOTICE OF INCOME GUIDELINES IN ALL REGISTRATION AREAS. INFORMATION ABOUT THE BENEVOLENCE AND COST SHARE PROGRAM AND THE INCOME GUIDELINES ARE AVAILABLE ON THE HOSPITAL'S INTERNET PAGE, GIVEN TO ALL PATIENTS AS PART OF THE PATIENT SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE'S PACKAGE, AND POSTED ON THE BACK SIDE OF ALL SELF PAY BILLING STATEMENTS.

PART VI, LINE 4: ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE TREATS PATIENTS FROM A SEVEN COUNTY AREA NORTH OF WATERVILLE, WITH A POPULATION OF 421,616, 31.7% OF MAINE'S POPULATION (BASED ON 2010 CENSUS DATA) WHICH ENCOMPASSES A LAND AREA OF 22,846 SQUARE MILES, 74% OF MAINE'S LAND AREA. THE HOSPITAL'S IMMEDIATE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SERVICE AREAS INCLUDE PENOBSCOT COUNTY, THE TOWNS OF BUCKSPORT AND ELLSWORTH IN HANCOCK COUNTY, AND THE TOWN OF MILO IN PISCATAQUIS COUNTY. IN 2010, 40.6% OF INPATIENT ADMISSIONS WERE LESS THAN 65 YEARS OF AGE AND 59.4% WERE 65 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER. THE U.S. 2010 DATA REPORTS THAT WITHIN ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE'S IMMEDIATE PRIMARY SERVICE AREA (PENOBSCOT COUNTY) DEMOGRAPHICS INCLUDE A POPULATION THAT IS 95.4% WHITE, 51.1% FEMALE, 89.2% WHO ARE HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATES, 70.5% WHO OWN A HOME, AND THE COUNTY'S MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME IS $40,301.

PART VI, LINE 6: IN THE AREA OF SERVING THE LESS FORTUNATE, PERHAPS THE CORNERSTONE OF OUR EFFORTS CONTINUES TO BE OUR HELP FOR THE BANGOR AREA HOMELESS SHELTER. GROUPS OF DEDICATED EMPLOYEES SERVE A HEALTHY, HOT MEAL TO THE GUESTS OF THE SHELTER ON A DESIGNATED DAY EACH MONTH. THE FOOD IS PREPARED AND DONATED BY OUR NUTRITION SERVICES DEPARTMENT. MEANWHILE THE HOSPITAL LAUNDRY DEPARTMENT CONTINUES TO PROVIDE COMPLIMENTARY WASH/DRY SERVICES FOR THE TONS OF SOILED LINENS GENERATED BY THE SHELTER EACH YEAR.IN RESPONSE TO PUBLIC HEALTH NEEDS, ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL PROVIDED NUMEROUS FREE SERVICES INCLUDING BLOOD DRIVES, PULMONARY REHABILITATION SERVICES TO THE BANGOR Y AND FREE BLOOD PRESSURE AND STROKE SCREENING. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDED NUMEROUS EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES WHICH HELPED ENHANCE COMMUNITY HEALTH. AMONG THEM WERE H1N1 INFLUENZA EDUCATION, HEALTH EDUCATION SESSIONS FOR SENIORS THROUGH THE HAMMOND STREET SENIOR CENTER AND ST. JOSEPH'S SENIOR WISE PROGRAM, PATIENT EDUCATION THROUGH THE MAINE BREAST AND CERVICAL HEALTH PROGRAM, ONGOING DONATIONS OF MEETING SPACE FOR NUMEROUS SUPPORT GROUPS AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND CONTINUING SUPPORT OF CLINICAL EDUCATION FOR NURSING AND MEDICAL STUDENTS.

PART VI, LINE 7: ST. JOSEPH HEALTHCARE IS COMPRISED OF ST. JOSEPH HOSPITAL, AN ACUTE CARE HOSPITAL, ST. JOSEPH AMBULATORY CARE INC., PHYSICIAN GROUP THAT PROVIDES PRIMARY AND SPECIALTY CARE, AND ST. JOSEPH HOMECARE AND HOSPICE WHICH PROVIDES HOME HEALTH AND HOSPICE SERVICES. BY JOINING COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEM IN 2010, ST. JOSEPH IS NOW ALIGNED WITH TWO ACUTE CARE HOSPITALS AND MULTIPLE SKILLED NURSING AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THOMAS DANCOES, PAUL BUCKLEY, RICHARD RENZI AND CHARLES PATTAVINA RECEIVED INCENTIVE BONUSES. SCOTT STERN RECEIVED A PRODUCTIVITY BONUS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE IS A FORMAL PRESENTATION OF THE 990 TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND THEN TO THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FORM DISCLOSING ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THESE CONFLICTS ARE KNOWN; ANY MEMBER WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS ASKED TO LEAVE THE MEETING OR ABSTAIN FROM VOTING OR BOTH.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THROUGH COMPENSATION SURVEYS/STUDIES AND EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS COMPENSATIONS ARE DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON EACH INDIVIDUAL REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED GAINS ON INVESTMENTS: 717,906. TRANSFER TO AFFILIATES: -5,803,948. LONG-TERM PENSION ADJUSTMENT: 10,703. NET AUXILIARY INCOME: -40,484. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: -5,115,823.
